page.title: 04Thornton Heath's History 1
page.content:
The Pond was a natural pond and was dated back before the 13th Century.It was filled in 1953.There are several Public Houses; one is the Wheatsheaf Inn which was built in 1700; another is The Plough and Harrow which stood where the old gallows was.The name Thornton Heath used to be called Gallows Green.
Colliers Water Lane used to be an important highway and there were several cottages; the largest was called Lilac Cottage which stood between numbers 25 to 31.It was knocked down early in this century.On this road there were lots of coal burners used by the colliers.Some people say that the pond was haunted by a young lady.
Trumble Gardens is quite recent.Cont.5
